## Instructor

![](img/marie.jpg){style="float:right; padding: 0 0 0 10px; width:150px; height:150px; border-radius: 50%; object-fit: cover;" fig-alt="Headshot of Marie Neubrander"}

Marie Neubrander is a second year Ph.D. student in the Department of Statistical Science at Duke University. Marie's research is focused on developing causal inference methods for text data with various applications in the social sciences.
